intro: Anthistiria prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate anthistiria, is a low-growing flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically has linear, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its compact growth habit, it is sometimes used in ornamental gardening for ground cover.
